name: Skybracer
desc: A Liyue Adeptus who died during the Archon War.

customize.text: Skybracer was an Adeptus who witnessed the Liyue foundation 3700 years ago. He was among the first Adepti who signed the contract with Rex Lapis and swore to protect the people. He also helped them during the relocation from the Guili Assembly to the harbor due to the flood.

His form of a divine beast is a deer with huge antlers — the hallows of Rex Lapis, which were Skybracer’s pride and joy. According to Madame Ping, Skybracer himself was always a show-off. The story goes that the antlers were made from the very essence of Rex Lapis's divine power, which made it the hardest material in all of Liyue.

During the Archon War there was an epic battle between demons and Adepti. Legend has it that the skies went black, there were howling winds and waves as high as houses. The vile demon struck again with all his might, but Skybracer managed to dodge the attack, so the hit landed on Mt. Tianheng. It was so powerful that the base of the mountain cracked. Suddenly, there was a thunderous sound of giant rocks rolling down the mountains, and the whole of Mt. Tianheng was on the verge of collapse. Skybracer knew he had to act quickly, so he summoned a fellow Adeptus. With a strike of his polearm this Adeptus tore clean the antlers of the Skybracer’s head. Skybracer used his own blood-drenched antlers as a wedge to prop up the mountain. His blood coated his head, but he just grotesquely wiped his hand across his blood-soaked skull, and began racing back up the mountain to wipe the vile demon off the face of the earth. He looked like a king of the demons himself, but to the people who lived below the mountain, Skybracer was their savior, a great and merciful Adeptus who had saved them all from certain doom. These people thought more highly of him than they thought of the Lord of Geo. Skybracer kept fighting with demons until his blood was drained and his life ran out. The blood that he lost in the battle turned into the Bishui River, and Mt. Tianheng still stands tall and proud to this day because of Skybracer’s feat.
The Mingxiao Lantern was dedicated to Skybracer during the Traveler’s first Lantern Rite festival.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Archon War
customize.desc: The war for the divine thrones, declared by the Heavenly Principles. As a result of the Archon War that finished about 2000 years ago, seven rulers of seven nations received the Gnoses, the divine throne, and the title of an Archon.

customize.name: Lantern Rite
customize.desc: Every year on the day of the first full moon, Liyue celebrates the Lantern Rite. At night, the people launch many Xiao Lanterns and one large Mingxiao Lantern into the sky. Inside each lantern is a piece of plaustrite and the heart's desires written on special sticks. The lanterns slowly float away, illuminating the way for the souls of Liyue's faithful defenders.

customize.name: Adepti
customize.desc: Adepti are a group of immortal illuminated beasts of Liyue, who have protected people for millennia.

customize.name: Madame Ping
customize.desc: Yaoyao and Xiangling's Master. She's an Adeptus, known as Streetward Rambler.

customize.text: Lantern Rite Footage from Genshin Impact: Mingxiao Convergence

But together, they will light up the night sky and turn it as bright as day.

The passing of time is marked by meals as we drink and make merry, blessed by nature's grace. From past to present, the years go by in the blink of an eye. Smoke of hearths brings us joy and domesticity paints a picture of everyday life. Delicate clouds chase the moon as the boat floats on the river of time.
